Reviews.Title: Sound Fixed
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this TV for Christmas. The sound quality on the TV was terrible. See review by Alec Bentley and others. My husband complanied to Philips. They said they have fixed the sound issues plus sent us a new TV.  Replacement TV sound is much better. I think as good as any of the very slim TV's. We were impressed that Philips responded to our complaint. Be aware the plastic surrounding the TV is black not dark green as it appears in all of Philips illustrations.

Reviews.Title: GREAT VISUALS!!! onboard speakers leave much to be desired
Reviews.Author: Joshsc
Reviews.Content: Has every input/out you'll need. AMAZING video. Great profile and looks. The onboard speakers are very weak in every category. Highly recommend this tv IF you plan on using an external stereo system with it (as I do)

Reviews.Title: Sent it back to Amazon - sound is terrible.
Reviews.Author: Pamela J. Castillo "cas92708"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a techno geek.  Just wanted a reasonably priced TV for our bedroom.  This one seemed to have all the amenities for a much lower price than most in it's category (such as the Samsung). I read the feedback that the sound wasn't great but thought it couldn't be that bad.  Well it is.  It sounds like a transistor radio. The speaker faces the back and you cannot adjust for more full sound depth.  It sounds like its coming from a tin can.  The picture was just okay too.  I thought I could add some speakers for around $50 and then be happy with it but the speakers I ordered arrived and they could not be hooked up without an amplifier so I had to return them.  All I wanted is decent sound, not asking for super duper theater quality.  So it went back today after I received my new Panasonic TV.  What a difference.  It cost much less and sound is great with a great picture too.

Reviews.Title: No way to get rid of overscan
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: The phillips FAQ/Manual for this TV indicated that you need to select the "Unscaled" mode to get rid of the default 5% overscan.  Except there is no unscaled more (nor 1:1 pixel, etc. mode).  Phone and email support aren't able to offer any help on this (they just loop through scripts).  If you intend to connect this device to any sort of Digital input, well, be sure you are comfortable with loosing 5% of the image on each side of the display (i.e. don't, buy a different product)

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great deal!
Reviews.Author: Laura Tapia
Reviews.Content: This TV has great picture quality, and yeah, the speakers aren't fantastic, but I really don't understand what everyone is complaining about. I was expecting them to be a lot worse than they are, but they sound like every other TV speakers I have ever heard. Don't go into a panic and go buying a surround sound system just because this TV has bad reviews on its sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Tweak it!
Reviews.Author: P. Miller "I'll take two!"
Reviews.Content: *EDIT* In case you run into the problem I did, here are the screws I'd recommend getting for wall mounting.  Because the screw locations are recessed on the VESA 100x200mm pattern, the screws that came with 2 mounts I had were far too short.Get 4mm screws (diameter) by 20mm in length.  Available at HD with hex head.*COMMENTARY* I don't expect much from TV speakers in a < 2" panel ...but agreed, these are unlistenable as the set ships.Typically I like to boost bass and treble to get a sound I like.  In this case, the first thing I noticed wasn't what I'd expect.  It wasn't that there was no bass ...it was that the sound was a muddy mid-bass disaster.  In small speakers you can't get decent bass, so I think Philips decided to crank the bass as much as possible to try and get some to come through.  This is a disaster.What I'd recommend ...go into the audio setup area - there are a lot of tweaking options.  Obviously 'to each their own' ...but give this a try as a starting point:Disable the simulated surround mode.Disable the volume leveling (messy on some program material).Go into the EQ, and from left to right (low to high frequencies) set:-8-30+3+5Yes, it looks ridiculous, but at least it becomes listenable.  From there modify it to your taste.  I have not tried a 'good' source yet, but on TV I noticed tons of variation in recording.  Once I get my blu-ray hooked up I may edit these values.Of course ideally you use external speakers, but a lot of people will use this as a 2nd TV and don't want to deal with that.  Best of luck!

Reviews.Title: Washed out brightness and color!
Reviews.Author: Hodo
Reviews.Content: If you're not sitting right in front of it, forget it!  Even then it is not nearly as crisp and bright as my 13 year old Panasonic 32 inch TV.  This is made by Funai--hence the low price and quality.  Compared to Sharps, Toshibas and Vizios I've seen it has a very poor picture.  Don't be fooled by the name, price and features--you will regret this TV if you ever have to watch anything other than Blu-ray on it, or are even a bit off axis or center with the screen.  BE WARNED! YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!  I returned mine after two days of frustration.  Don't buy any TV sight unseen--make sure you see an actual one playing real shows and DVD's before you take the plunge.  It is a mistake to judge any TV only by the highest quality signal you can feed it!

Reviews.Title: Really nice, especially for the money
Reviews.Author: rob the computer guy
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these to use as computer monitors.  They are really great TV's and monitors. They were light and thin, and displayed a great picture.I had a quirk on my computer where the display would not work DVI-HDMI so I couldn't get them to work with my computer.  Apparently this has something to do with HDCP.

Reviews.Title: Decent video for the price, but miserable audio
Reviews.Author: Sean Kinney
Reviews.Content: As noted by most of the other reviewers, the audio quality is quite horrible. The speakers lack even the slightest bass and sound awfully tinny. Not a huge deal if you plan to use it with a receiver and speakers, but it's bad enough that I wouldn't recommend it if you can't afford/don't already have a good audio setup. If you're stuck using the TV with the built-in speakers, you can make it sound a little fuller by tweaking the EQ, but it only helps so much.It seemed relatively well-priced for a 1080p TV that's LED backlit, as it was on sale for $300 when I bought it. However, it's currently going for $389 as of this review, which is a bit much. You may want to look around for a TV without the audio issues described.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Alec Bentley "Alec"
Reviews.Content: We have just set the TV up. Color of the plastic surround  is black but all illustrations make it look green. Sound quality is terrible. If you buy this TV add the cost of additional speakers because the inboard mounted ones are tinny with no base at all. Compared with our Sony TV the picture quality is marginal. Have express our disappointment to Philips so hopefully they will take it back.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price...Needs Externam Speakers!
Reviews.Author: Katlin Shoup
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as my first HDTV...fabulous price for the quality of picture!!!! The only down side to this TV (as mentioned in all other reviews) is yes, the sound quality is pretty gross. We just bought some Logitech computer speakers for about 30 bucks and hooked them up. Perfect for a (college student) apartment dweller.This TV is really flexible...with its 3HDMI ports we use it as a TV, for video gaming and as a computer monitor.This TV gives supreme picture quality - better than most LCD TV's!Bottom line - buy it...buy some other speakers as well and you're set!Oh!!! And my biggest advice is after you buy it CHECK THE PRICE ON AMAZON for two weeks after! After I bought mine the price went down $100 the NEXT day and they refunded me because of their low price guarantee!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Stunning
Reviews.Author: Taras Ukrainchuk
Reviews.Content: I bought this in replacement for my 22" monitor and man can I tell you, MASSIVE difference! Not only in size, but picture quality and clarity. I managed to pick one up at Target for $377.54, that's with tax included. It has many connectors and easily hooked up to my computer. Pick up a cheap hmdi cable if you're going to be buying from amazon, they're much, MUCH cheaper here than at any retail store. I know my review is rather vague, but really, whether you use it as a tv or a monitor, it won't dissapoint. The setup when you first start it up configures it quite nicely. I did have to do a small tweak in my video card's software to fix the overscan. It's a quick and easy fix and nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: Flawed LCD TV
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: I read the review about the overscan.  I already bought the TV and confirmed the issue.  Firmware upgrade does not allow for correction.  I'm heading out now to return the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Riverbandit
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to take on a trip with me.  I couldn't believe the price for an LED TV, but there doesn't appear to be a catch.  This TV has a great picture and plenty of connections.  It is easy to use and program as well.  The speakers are a little quiet, but not too bad.  I hooked up a cheap set of speakers to it and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Returning the TV
Reviews.Author: MW
Reviews.Content: As everyone on here says, the picture is perfect, but the sound is giving me a head ache it's so bad. I am taking it back. Had less than 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Picture. Sound is a little low but still works well.
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: This tv is very clear and sleak with its picure in 1080p. I understand that the sound is not to great because the speakers are in the back. For my bed room the tv sound works for me great but in a living or rec room you would want to consider external speakers.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for this price!
Reviews.Author: Julia
Reviews.Content: TV has bright colors and the picture is saturated. It's easy to set up with PC and PS3.The problem was that on the 3rd day, it got broke: very loud noise appeared. We called Philips customer service and they shipped us a new TV. As soon as we get it, we'll need to ship the broken one. It's such a headache to do all these things!Still, maybe we just got unlucky. This TV has very spectacular picture.

Reviews.Title: crystal clear
Reviews.Author: lighthouse
Reviews.Content: I bought this t.v. for my son for Christmas.  Really great picture.  I like the LED energy star features.  He loves the gaming video.  Unbelievable value.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Is a great tv. Have had it for a few weeks now. Amazing picture.Great sound. Have it set up to a ps3 for blueray is great.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, great look - thin, lowest price = best value by far
Reviews.Author: ATIrish
Reviews.Content: Bought this about a month ago, was upgrading from an old 720p 32" LG... Besides being lighter, much thinner, and $600 cheaper, the picture contrast and definition is much better: much deeper blacks, sharper, brighter images.

Reviews.Title: Thoroughly impressed
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: Great color values, awesome viewing angle and great sound quality. Works perfect for my living room needs. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good but sounds is bad
Reviews.Author: Julian
Reviews.Content: This TV has been of excellent quality. My only issue is that the sound is quite terrible. If you are going to buy this TV I highly recommend getting some sound system with it.Everything else has worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Too cheap to have Speaker jacks?
Reviews.Author: Easy Critic
Reviews.Content: All tvs should have speaker jacks on them so folks can hook up their own speakers and not depend on the ultra-cheap ones that come in most tv sets! Very low cost to do, so why not? e.g. You plug your speaker plug in and it cuts out the internal speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Kc
Reviews.Content: Bought this on amazon sale. EXCELLENT video quality. Good audio (but I hook it up to computer speakers). I use this for MW3 and netflix. Working well 2 years running.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Lwins
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the review I was wondering if this product would hold up.  I have had it for more than a year now and it has been excellent with no problems.  Sound & picture quality have been what the company advertized.  I have really enjoyed it.  Worth every dollar I spent.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture
Reviews.Author: Annis H Reichow
Reviews.Content: Best picture of the 4 lcd TV's we've had in the house..The viewing angle is the best I have ever seen ,of any lcd , anywhere.....The next one will be a Philips also.... The channel scan ,by stepping throughall the auxillary inputs is a mystery , as the remote control has a button for theauxillary inputs...

Reviews.Title: Poor quality components
Reviews.Author: Free Man
Reviews.Content: After a year the TV would cycle on then switch itself off. One would have to go through the process numerous times before it eventually stayed on. I had encountered this problem previously some years ago and presumed (stupid me) that Philips would have corrected the problem. But for the cost of a 10 cent component (diode) I would have a decent TV. As far as I know this is a problem across the range of Philips TVs.Philips do not like trouble-shooting by e-mail. Although they have an e-mail support address they still ask customers to call. (Maybe they get a kick out of telling customers in person that there is nothing they can do because the warranty has expired?)As a general rule I like Philips products, and would be happy with this TV if it had not failed, but now I feel they have betrayed my trust.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: Yamaharider
Reviews.Content: We love this television, we actually use it in our bedroom as a our t.v., and our monitor for our computer.  We love the quality of it, and the picture is fantastic.  So pleased we found it at such a great price through Amazon, thanks a million.

Reviews.Title: It's OK, but not great.  Don't buy it just for the price.
Reviews.Author: Newbie in New York
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before purchasing this TV, and went into this purchase armed with information available at Amazon and elsewhere.  That having been said, despite my higher hopes, I am somewhat disappointed in what came out of the box.  I think this TV's performance falls squarely in the middle of the poor-to-good quality continuum.  At the outset, let me say that I did not purchase this TV with any expectation of listening through its speakers since I have it playing through a 5.1 sound system already in place.  Even so, despite the terrible reviews regarding sound quality, before I hooked it into my sound system, it sounded about as good or bad as I'd expected from its small on board speakers, which means that in a small room, for basic everyday viewing, the speakers are adequate enough.This TV replaced a Panasonic 32-inch 720p I purchased about 7 years ago, which worked just fine.  I wanted to trade up to higher resolution and to LED backlighting, and I thought the Philips would bridge that gap economically.  Although I've got another Panasonic and a Samsung too, the Philips is in the bedroom, where I hang out most to watch television including Blu-ray DVD and video streamed from Apple TV.  Unfortunately, the Panasonic I replaced was a much higher quality TV, and the Philips can't measure up favorably to it, even with the LED backlighting and higher 1080p resolution.The things I'm dissatisfied with:  You must watch this television straight on, as others have said.  Accept that as the gospel truth.  I've never seen a television with such a narrow viewing angle.  The published viewing angle is just not correct.  If you don't watch it straight on, the colors are faded and the picture loses clarity, like the first generation of flat screen computer monitors which have since improved tremendously. If you do watch it straight on, most of the time the color/resolution/contrast/brightness are pretty good, but in order to get there, you need to tweak the hell out of the settings, since the defaults just won't do it.  The Panasonic had higher contrast which means darker blacks and brighter whites and vivid colors with an overall depth the Philips lacks.  Using the Blu-ray DVD player or streaming from Apple TV amps up the picture quality somewhat, but other video sources are not as successful, like live cable or programming recorded on an HD DVR.  Unlike most other brands, having LED backlighting does not make the Philips picture any brighter or more vivid than an ordinary LCD.  The really aggravating part is the lack of consistency in display quality.  I have this television about 1 month, and I've recently begun to notice some strange artifacts in the picture, particularly in scenes with low light.  The picture becomes quite grainy, and when that happens, it seems to pulsate between not-so-grainy and very grainy.  Brighter scenes become less grainy.  But that's not always the case since it happens intermittently; you can watch the same program through the same source, and scenes that are dark are often quite clear and stable, but without any warning, the grainy quality reappears.  It may go a few days without this happening at all, but then the problem returns inexplicably.  Not yet sure what that's all about, but I am sure its not intended by Philips to happen, and if this problem becomes persistent, then I'll return it. I'm hoping against hope that it rights itself. I'm still well within the warranty period.The things I like:  when the source is solid and its not displaying any strange artifacts, the picture is decent if somewhat lesser in quality than a more expensive and tested brand such as Samsung and Panasonic.  For a modestly priced TV, it's pretty stylish with a piano black bezel so it's easy to look at when it's off.  It has a light at the base when its powered up.  The stand is very low, and I've had to raise the viewing height by resting the TV on an additional platform.  Viewing the Panasonic in the same space required no additional platform.  When it's working properly, I'm happier with the product, and feeling good that I didn't raid the college fund to buy it.  The remote is about as basis as it gets; I use a multi-function remote, and as far as I'm concerned, the Philips remote is a toss-away.  But when it's acting funky, I'm less happy.  Again, because it is neither consistently good or bad, I haven't been as quick to return it as I might.Bottom line:  If you can, save a bit more money before you buy your next TV, and don't be tempted by the lowest price.  You'll probably end up with a better experience in the long run.  However, if that's not possible, so long as it behaves properly, this TV is more than just sufficient--it can display your favorite video sources nicely.  It just won't blow you away as other sets might.

Reviews.Title: Good picture but bad sound
Reviews.Author: Bryan W. Davenport "Bryan"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great, however the sound quality is pretty poor.  In order to get better sound you must purchase about $200 in equipment.  I still enjoy the television, but cringe when I hear the first sounds.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Héctor Z
Reviews.Content: The image and the price are pretty good, it sounds clear for me, I mean I just wanna watch TV and this model offers a good price since it's a LED. You could buy speakers if you want to improve the sound

Reviews.Title: Good!
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: This has been the best TV I've had. I use this in my dorm room as a monitor/TV and it works great! The colors are beautiful in high def.a few cons: 1) The sound is TERRIBLE. Don't even bother thinking "Oh, i'll get use to it". You won't, and you'll hate yourself every minute when you're trying to watch a movie. It sounds like the speakers are underwater.  2) The colors are off when using it as a monitor. I never had this problem with my acer. I think it may be my color settings on my computer.  3) It doesn't tell you what station you're on when you change channels. Very VERY annoying

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Alain Le Lous "ALLred"
Reviews.Content: Grat prize and awesome picture! No more to say, everything have been explained, the room where it is, is kind of little (no problem with the sound, but I see why people complain about that). So if I decide then change it from that room, I will enchance it with speackers, that's all. Works awesome with the PS3 and the DVD. No issues by now, great buy, Philips got me.

Reviews.Title: Pink stripe video problem
Reviews.Author: kclady
Reviews.Content: After about three weeks, the set developed a bright pink stripe down the picture. Stripe would develop about an hour after turning the set on and was four to five inches in width, running the length from top to bottom. Gonna have to take back to store (didn't purchase via Amazon) and see what they'll do. Was closeout reduced price, can't replace it for the price I paid.Sucks...

Reviews.Title: 4 Stars for what it is
Reviews.Author: Scrantonicity
Reviews.Content: If you need a cheap decent size screen for a small area then this TV is 4 stars.  If you are looking for a nice smaller TV then this is a 2.5-3 star TV.  If you want a TV for your primary TV watching and the room is medium to large then this is not the TV for you.I bought this TV for my bedroom and it gives a a good size TV with a decent picture for a great price.  The color isn't as good as a more expensive TV but it looks good.  The sound isn't great but if you have speaker to hook up or just need a way for the audio to get to your ears without needing it to be movie quality then this will work just fine.This is a great alternate TV for a smaller room.  Its hard to beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: philips 32" hd television
Reviews.Author: jaydee
Reviews.Content: very happy with the purchase. using the tv for a computer monitor. easy set up....power cord and hdmi cable and up and running in five minutes out of the box. nice picture, colors and contrast levels. not even using the sound, so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV but no VGA
Reviews.Author: lovely
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon and unfortunately ended up returning it. I use my TV mostly to connect through my Laptop and though this one did not have a VGA input I though I still might buy it as it is one LED with good quality picture and available at this good price.Nice picture quality and sleek TV.Though you wont buy it if the sole purpose is VGA connectivity, i tried all VGA to HDMI cable (never works), I donno why these guys even sell those if they cant work. And also tried the VGA to HDMI converter but nothing helped, so had to return..

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: bitsy999
Reviews.Content: one of the best purchases i've made lately - excellent product for the priceif  you need a new tv and don't need expensive frills - this is a great choice

Reviews.Title: good tv
Reviews.Author: Mr angry
Reviews.Content: The TV is great, I use a seperate source for sound so cant judge it but the image is bright and crisp.It arrived in a bashed up box and I thought it might be second hand but the product inside looked totaly pristine

Reviews.Title: excellent tv
Reviews.Author: ladyinred
Reviews.Content: i am happy that i purchased this tv. the picture quality is great. it arrived right on time and was easy to set up. it does take a little while for it to "boot up" but that's because its an energy efficient tv.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING QUALITY!!!
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: This IS well worth the money spending. The quality is beyond what I expected and still cant believe I got an outstanding deal on it.

Reviews.Title: I liked it
Reviews.Author: r
Reviews.Content: It was TV for my son and I think it is nicely serves the purpose. Have nothing bad to say about this TV so far

Reviews.Title: Philips is Philips ... Years on tech!!!
Reviews.Author: Alexander Jose Perales "Jose Perales"
Reviews.Content: Great Tv that all new tech recently requirements to see a Great Movies, HD Tv, 1080p, Blue rays, etc. comes with 3 HDMI great for apple Tv in my case, Direct Tv and Wii. Very Sharp and easy to setup, the weight is great to be mount on the wall.In general tremendous price and You get Led, 1080p, great stuff

Reviews.Title: Sweet
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: The t.v. was delivered in about five days from the time of purchase. It works great. Plenty of connections for my devices. Really great picture quality. The sound leaves much to be desired. This however is not a problem, just connected it to my sound system. Video games look great, I can actually read the text now. I like the initial left side right side picture setup. Literally couldn't beat the price. The description says it's 120 but the manual says it's 60?

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Price, Horrible Speakers
Reviews.Author: jred
Reviews.Content: The video quality is great and it is extremely light.  For the price it is hard to complain but the speakers are pretty horrible.  It echos bad and there is no bass available.  Since this is just my bedroom tv I am happy with it.  I am seriously considering getting some cheap computer speakers then it will be a perfect tv.

Reviews.Title: the sound sucks
Reviews.Author: santa fe
Reviews.Content: great picture.the worst sound you ever have ever heard.keep looking! ours is going back to sam's tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality
Reviews.Author: Stuart Michael Feistner
Reviews.Content: For the price, the definition and quality is crystal clear. You would be hard pressed to find a better bargain than here, plus with the Phillips name behind the TV, you know you're not getting jipped. The remote is simplistic and easy to use and the setup for your preferences is full-proof. The only downside is "Why isn't it a 50 inch?"

Reviews.Title: broken bats
Reviews.Author: cal
Reviews.Content: i did a lot of looking before i bought this tv  i bought it mainly fo the price  the picture is great but as i read in other reviews the speakers leave a lot to be desired  i watched a red sox game the other day and when someone made contact it sounded like a broken bat and when i was watching drag racing  when they went down the track it sounds like you are listening through a long pipe  movies are not as bad as the sports  however that aside i would buy another one

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT hdtv for the bedroom.  :-)
Reviews.Author: WaterfordJim
Reviews.Content: .....I have seen reviews giving this TV poor marks for it's audio.... There is nothing wrong with the sound. For watching sports or even movies, it sounds fine. :-) -If you were expecting studio monitor sound out of a flat screen, you will be disappointed with any flat screen!  Since this TV was for the bedroom, its primary use is for watching PORN and GAY PORN and this TV ROCKS!  The picture is so stunningly clear that it looks like these twinks are going at it right in front of you! HOT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Question regarding 3D Capability
Reviews.Author: David Paul Thompson
Reviews.Content: So this may be a stupid question since I have a slightly above average understanding of new tech, but I was wondering if a seperate 3D tuner is needed to produce true 3D even though it is 120hz. I know this is the issue with HD as opposed to HD-Ready TV's. Thanks for your help!

Reviews.Title: Box condition
Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, the wrapping and the way it came secured but the box was deteriorated and in my case I was going to sell it in another country but due to box condition I had to lower the price....

ProductInfo.Features:
2 HDMI inputs
PC input via HDMI
LED - edgelit
Refresh rate: 60Hz
Energy Star 4.0
ProductInfo.Name: Philips 32PFL4505D/F7 32-Inch 1080p LED LCD HDTV, Black
